question:
The first commitment period of the Kyoto Protocol cover emissions of which of the following greenhouse gases?
1. Carbon dioxide (CO2)
2. Methane (CH4)
3. Nitrous oxide (N2O)
4. Hydrofluorocarbons (HFCs)
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation:
The first commitment period of the Kyoto Protocol cover emissions of the six main greenhouse gases, which are as follows:
1. Carbon dioxide (CO2)
2. Methane (CH4)
3. Nitrous oxide (N2O)
4. Hydrofluorocarbons (HFCs)
5. Perfluorocarbons (PFCs)
6. Sulphur hexafluoride (SF6)
